October 5, 1997: Fiction
COLD MOUNTAIN, by Charles Frazier. (Atlantic Monthly, $24.) A wounded
Confederate soldier journeys home toward the end of the Civil War to meet an old
love and a new world.
THE BEST LAID PLANS, by Sidney Sheldon. (Morrow, $25.) The relationship
between a power-hungry governor and a beautiful woman determined to wreak
revenge.
FLOOD TIDE, by Clive Cussler. (Simon & Schuster, $26.) Dirk Pitt in pursuit of a
notorious Chinese smuggler at work in the United States.
THE ANGEL OF DARKNESS, by Caleb Carr. (Random House, $25.95.) Dr.
Kreizler and his team pursue the kidnapper of a Spanish diplomat's child in 1897
Manhattan.
UNDERWORLD, by Don DeLillo. (Scribner, $27.50.) From the Polo Grounds to
cyberspace: American life as lived by a man and woman during the past 50 years.
UNNATURAL EXPOSURE, by Patricia Cornwell. (Putnam, $25.95.) Dr. Kay
Scarpetta contends with a killer who uses a smallpox-like virus and cyberspace
tricks.
THE NOTEBOOK, by Nicholas Sparks. (Warner, $16.95.) A World War II veteran
meets an old flame who is about to be married.
SPECIAL DELIVERY, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $16.95.) Romance comes to
a mature couple who disliked each other in earlier encounters.
THE GOD OF SMALL THINGS, by Arundhati Roy. (Random House, $23.) Death
and secrets haunt a once-prosperous merchant family in contemporary India.
DEJA DEAD, by Kathy Reichs. (Scribner, $24.) Dr. Temperance Brennan hunts a
serial killer at large in Montreal.
LONDON, by Edward Rutherfurd. (Crown, $25.95.) Two thousand years of life in
Britain's capital as seen through the eyes of six families.
PLUM ISLAND, by Nelson DeMille. (Warner, $25.) A detective probes the murder
of a Long Island couple who may have been involved in germ warfare research.
THE PARTNER, by John Grisham. (Doubleday, $26.95.) The pursuit of $90 million
stolen by a lawyer who apparently died but is actually hiding in Brazil.
IF THIS WORLD WERE MINE, by E. Lynn Harris. (Doubleday, $23.95.) The
seemingly close bonds of four old classmates are strained when a stranger
suddenly enters their lives.
October 5, 1997
Non-Fiction
THE ROYALS, by Kitty Kelley. (Warner, $27.) Gossip about the private lives of
members of the House of Windsor.
ANGELA'S ASHES, by Frank McCourt. (Scribner, $24.) An Irish-American writer
recalls his childhood amid the miseries of Limerick.
THE MAN WHO LISTENS TO HORSES, by Monty Roberts. (Random House,
$23.) The memoirs of a professional horse trainer.
THE PERFECT STORM, by Sebastian Junger. (Norton, $23.95.) An account of
the nor'easter of 1991, focusing on a crew of fishermen from Gloucester, Mass.
INTO THIN AIR, by Jon Krakauer. (Villard, $24.95.) A journalist's account of his
ascent of Mount Everest in 1996, the deadliest season in history.
CONVERSATIONS WITH GOD: Book 1, by Neale Donald Walsch. (Putnam,
$19.95.) The author addresses questions of good and evil, guilt and sin.
MIDNIGHT IN THE GARDEN OF GOOD AND EVIL, by John Berendt. (Random
House, $23.) The mysterious death of a young man in Savannah, Ga.
BABYHOOD, by Paul Reiser. (Weisbach/Morrow, $22.) The problems and
pleasures of parenthood as perceived by the television star and comedian.
THE GIFT OF FEAR, by Gavin de Becker. (Little, Brown, $22.95.) Intuitive signals
that can protect us from becoming the victims of violence.
DOGS NEVER LIE ABOUT LOVE, by Jeffrey Moussaieff Masson. (Crown, $24.) A
psychoanalyst's reflections on the emotional lives of dogs.
TEARS OF RAGE, by John Walsh with Susan Schindehette. (Pocket, $24.) The
host of ''America's Most Wanted'' recalls the agony he suffered following the
kidnapping and murder of his young son.
THE MILLIONAIRE NEXT DOOR, by Thomas J. Stanley and William D. Danko.
(Longstreet, $22.) An analysis of the lives of wealthy Americans discloses that
they have seven characteristics in common.
EVEN THE STARS LOOK LONESOME, by Maya Angelou. (Random House,
$18.) Twenty essays by the poet on a variety of topics.
THE BIBLE CODE, by Michael Drosnin. (Simon & Schuster, $25.) A journalist
contends that important events have been predicted in the Bible.
BRAIN DROPPINGS, by George Carlin. (Hyperion, $19.95.) Comments on life
and the ways of the world by the stand-up comedian.
